HowItWorks.title: How it works?
HowItWorks.intro: FOROM brings economic and public decision-makers concrete improvement proposals directly from their users and citizens.
HowItWorks.goalBody1: The platform structures the full journey of an idea: proposition, votes, ownership, and delivery.
HowItWorks.goalBody2: Each step stays publicly visible so everyone can see what is moving, what is blocked, and what has actually shipped.
HowItWorks.goalExampleSuffix: gets community votes, is handled by the team, then moves to "Done"
HowItWorks.goalExampleSentence2BeforeBadge: The community considers this proposition useful and supports it by voting. Google's teams decide to implement it and, once the feature is live, they add the
HowItWorks.goalExampleSentence2AfterBadge: badge to keep the community informed.
HowItWorks.forWhoBody1: Users who want real agency: propose an idea, rally community votes, and track progress over time.
HowItWorks.forWhoBody2: Companies and entrepreneurs: companies get high-signal feedback to prioritize better, while entrepreneurs spot real unsolved problems worth building for.
HowItWorks.forWhoUsersBody: Share ideas, gather votes, and track progress with full transparency.
HowItWorks.forWhoOrgBody: Understand real community priorities and focus teams on the highest-impact improvements.
HowItWorks.forWhoFoundersBody: Spot concrete pain points and unmet needs to build relevant new solutions.
HowItWorks.pagesBody1: A page represents an entity: a company, a brand, a city, a service, etc.
HowItWorks.pagesBody2: Each page centralizes related propositions and helps owners understand community expectations.
HowItWorks.pagesExampleBody: The "Google" page gathers all Google-related propositions, their votes, statuses, and shipped updates.
HowItWorks.propositionsBody1: A proposition is a concrete improvement idea. Example: "Add dark mode", "Simplify refund flow".
HowItWorks.propositionsBody2: Each proposition can receive votes and move through statuses (open, in progress, done, etc.).
HowItWorks.propositionsExampleBody: "Add dark mode": the proposition collects votes, moves to "In progress", then to "Done" once actually shipped.
HowItWorks.step1Body: Create a proposition on an existing page (or as a general proposition).
HowItWorks.step2Body: The community votes to highlight the most relevant ideas.
HowItWorks.step3Body: Statuses evolve over time (open, in progress, done), so progress stays visible to everyone.
HowItWorks.step4Body: When an idea is implemented, the proposition is marked done: feedback becomes action.
HowItWorks.exampleBody: Concrete example: someone posts an improvement on the Google page. Votes grow, the team picks it up, and the proposition is eventually shipped.
HowItWorks.exampleMeta: Page: Google | Type: Product proposition | Votes: 212
HowItWorks.ctaBody: You can explore existing propositions, or create a page to centralize ideas around a specific topic.
HowItWorks.footerNote: FOROM makes decisions more transparent: you can see ideas, priorities, and outcomes.
HowItWorks.faqIntro: Find answers to the most common questions about how FOROM works.
HowItWorks.faqSeoDescription: Frequently asked questions about FOROM: account, propositions, pages, statuses, and idea prioritization.
HowItWorks.faqPurposeQ1: What is the purpose of FOROM?
HowItWorks.faqPurposeA1: FOROM aims to make decisions more transparent and participatory. Users can submit ideas, vote for the ones that matter most, and track their progress. Organizations (brands, local authorities, services) get a dedicated page to collect these propositions, prioritize using votes, and communicate outcomes. The goal is to give visibility to expectations and results.
HowItWorks.faqAccountQ1: Do I need an account to post an idea?
HowItWorks.faqAccountA1: You can explore freely. To vote, propose, and manage notifications, you need to sign in.
HowItWorks.faqAccountQ2: I did not receive the confirmation email. What should I do?
HowItWorks.faqAccountA2: Check your spam folder and the email address you entered. You can also retry from the login screen.
HowItWorks.faqAccountQ3: Can I sign in with only email and password?
HowItWorks.faqAccountA3: Yes. FOROM supports email/password authentication with account recovery if needed.
HowItWorks.faqAccountQ4: Can I use FOROM without being signed in?
HowItWorks.faqAccountA4: Yes for browsing pages and propositions. Signing in is required to interact (vote, propose, comment, follow).
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsQ1: What is the difference between a page and a proposition?
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA1: A page is the topic (brand, city, service). A proposition is the improvement idea attached to that topic.
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA2: Votes help surface the most important expectations. They support prioritization but do not replace feasibility analysis.
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsQ3: Why does my proposition not move forward despite votes?
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA3: Votes matter, but complexity, cost, technical dependencies, and legal constraints also influence decisions.
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsQ4: What statuses can a proposition have?
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA4: Open: the proposition is published and waiting for review. In progress: it is owned and being worked on. Done: the solution is shipped and live. Won't do: the proposition is not selected at this stage.
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsQ5: How do I create a proposition?
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA5: From a page, click "Add a proposition", or use the Omnibar directly. Write a clear title, describe the problem and expected outcome, then publish.
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsQ6: How do I add a solution in comments?
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA6: You can reply in comments on a proposition. Page owners can then mark a comment as a solution to highlight a useful answer.
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsQ7: How can a proposition status be changed?
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA7: Statuses are updated by authorized people on the page (owners/team). Changes are visible in the public tracking flow.
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsQ8: Can I post an idea without a page?
HowItWorks.faqPropositionsA8: Yes. You can create general propositions and link them to a page later when relevant.
HowItWorks.faqPagesA1: Any signed-in user can propose a page. Owners then manage settings and follow-up.
HowItWorks.faqPagesQ2: What is a page used for?
HowItWorks.faqPagesA2: A page centralizes propositions, votes, and progress history for a given organization or service.
HowItWorks.faqPagesA3: Yes. Parent/child link requests can be used to structure topics and avoid duplicates.
HowItWorks.faqPagesQ4: How do I follow a page?
HowItWorks.faqPagesA4: You can subscribe to a page or proposition to receive notifications when important updates happen.
HowItWorks.faqPagesA5: A verified page indicates that an organization has been confirmed as the legitimate owner or manager of that page.
HowItWorks.faqPagesQ6: How can I verify my page?
HowItWorks.faqPagesA6: From the page, submit a verification request with the required details. Once approved, the page becomes verified.
HowItWorks.faqPagesQ7: How do I create a page?
HowItWorks.faqPagesA7: Go to "Create a page", fill in the main details (name, description, category), then publish.
HowItWorks.faqPagesQ8: Can I embed my page propositions table on my own website?
HowItWorks.faqPagesA8: Yes. FOROM provides an embed mode to display a page's proposition list on an external website.
HowItWorks.faqModerationA0: Explorer mode helps you quickly browse propositions, filter by status, and spot trending topics.
HowItWorks.faqModerationQ1: Who decides the final status of a proposition?
HowItWorks.faqModerationA1: Owners and teams managing the page update statuses based on real implementation progress.
HowItWorks.faqModerationQ2: How are abuse and off-topic content handled?
HowItWorks.faqModerationA2: Page owners can moderate content and keep discussions focused on concrete improvement proposals.
HowItWorks.faqModerationA3: Yes. A proposition can be marked as "Won't do" when it is not selected, with transparent tracking.
HowItWorks.faqModerationQ4: How do I know when an idea is truly delivered?
HowItWorks.faqModerationA4: Once implemented, the proposition is marked "Done" and subscribers receive a notification.
HowItWorks.faq1Q: Do I need an account to post an idea?
HowItWorks.faq1A: You can explore freely. To vote, propose, and manage notifications, you need to sign in.
HowItWorks.faq2Q: What is the difference between a page and a proposition?
HowItWorks.faq2A: A page is the topic (brand, city, service). A proposition is the improvement idea for that topic.
HowItWorks.faq3Q: Who decides the final status of a proposition?
HowItWorks.faq3A: Owners and teams managing the page update statuses based on real implementation progress.
HowItWorks.faq4Q: Why doesn't my proposition move forward even with votes?
HowItWorks.faq4A: Votes help prioritize, but feasibility, impact, and available resources also influence decisions.

placeholderSamples: Spotify: Create a "Sleep" mode that gradually lowers volume in the last 15 minutes.
LinkedIn: Add a 'Salary shown' filter to hide jobs without pay range
SNCF: Show the cheapest prices per day when opening the calendar
